727389f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - Pleasant View Street
727389f-a.text:
Metropolitan Avene, north side, at and adjoining Pleasantview Street, showing at the right, in two views, the Tallenstrab house on the site of Mrs. Coe's house. The Fearless Hook and lLadder Co, No. 7,
orgwnized in 1870, adjoins the first mentioned house.
1922
Views 1and 2
Eugene L. Arrbruster Collection
727389f-a.folder: Metropolitan Avenue & Pleasant View Street, Queens, NY

727391f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - Pleasant View Street
727391f-a.text:
7219-7241 Metropolitan Avenue, north side, east of Pleasantview Street, showing in the foreground white Bldg., a part of the Cornish Country house of 1870. One Wackenhut built the addition. He still Owns both houses. Eugene L. Armbruster states it is on the site of the Losee house. Fred Weiss' Hotel is in the center of the view.
March 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
727391f-a.folder: Metropolitan Avenue & Pleasant View Street, Queens, NY

727412f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - Pleasant View Street
727412f-a.text:
Wetropolitan Avenue (old No. 2039) north side, west of Pleasantview Street (right, not shown) showing Mrs. Ways' house. A later owner was John Sutter. E.H. Girard known as "01d Florist Girard" was the occupant in 19C3. This house is not Mrs. S. Ways'
personal home of 1852 nor that of Chas. F. Way.
March 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
727412f-a.folder: Metropolitan Avenue & Pleasant View Street, Queens, NY
